page.title: 01BADDESLEY CLINTON:SURVEY
page.content: { The area is typical of rural Warwick- shire,a scatter of{small villages,}in sharp contrast to the nearby cities of Birmingham and Coventry. Land use is mainly{agricultural.}Most is intensively managed grass for use as{pasture, silage or hay.}The secondary land cover is cropland - mainly barley and wheat.{Sheep}are the most common grazing animals,with cattle as the next. There are several {woodland}areas, predominantly deciduous, e.g.Haywood, but some coniferous, e.g.Clattylands Wood. The few{amenities}are concentrated in the villages.Baddesley Clinton offers most:a primary school, a Post Office and food shop,an antique shop,an inn- "The Orange Tree",a restaurant,a farm selling "Pick Your Own" strawberries and a historic manor house.
